headline.main: A Peace Force After the War?

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Relief Groups Seek a Peacekeeping Force for Afghanistan'' (news article, Nov. 22): It is premature to deploy a multinational force until a broad-based and representative coalition is established in Afghanistan. Afghan factions will meet next week to discuss creation of a provisional council. This legitimate transitional authority would be in a position to request a United Nations peacekeeping operation. Unless peacekeepers are invited, foreign troops will be seen as another occupying force and could face attacks from Afghan warlords.
abstract: David L Phillips letter, commenting on November 22 article, says it is premature to deploy multinational peacekeeping force in Afghanistan until country establishes broad-based and representative political coalition
